questions.question: In circular motion, the velocity vector is always oriented:
options: Toward the center of the circle.
Away from the center of the circle.
Opposite to the direction of motion.
questions.explanation: In circular motion, velocity is always tangent to the circular path.

questions.question: What is the definition of a radian?
options: The angle where the arc length equals the radius.
The distance from the center to the rim.
The time it takes for one full revolution.
questions.explanation: One radian is the angle subtended when the arc length equals the radius.

questions.question: Which quantity describes the number of revolutions per second?
questions.explanation: Frequency is the number of revolutions per second. Period is time per revolution.

questions.question: To convert an angle from degrees to radians, you should multiply by:
questions.explanation: $180^\circ = \pi$ radians, so multiply degrees by $\pi/180$ to get radians.

questions.question: For a point on a rotating wheel, how does the tangential speed ($v$) relate to the radius ($r$) and angular speed ($\omega$)?
questions.explanation: $v = r\omega$, where $\omega$ is in radians per second.

questions.question: One complete revolution is equal to how many radians?
What is the SI unit for frequency?
questions.explanation: Frequency is measured in Hertz (Hz), which is cycles per second.

questions.question: Uniform circular motion means:
questions.explanation: Uniform circular motion has constant speed but continuously changing direction, so velocity is not constant.

questions.question: A merry-go-round completes one full rotation every 5 seconds. What is its frequency?
If a wheel has a frequency of $4 \text{ Hz}$, what is its period?
